channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Receive salary and tuition for graduate school; plan now for 2026 and beyond | April 16 (Please Register)
item.description: Date: Wednesday, April 16, 2025 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - Competitive fellowships provide salary and tuition for masters and PhD students. Graduate students, juniors, and seniors will learn how to find and apply to appropriate programs that will fund fall 2026 and beyond. International students are welcome! For information, contact madige@rpi.edu or Register here: https://surveys.rpi.edu/jfe/form/SV_85M3eKII9idFy5M
item.author: Students

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Mechanical Engineering Review April 16
item.description: Date: Wednesday, April 16, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Join Rensselaer at Work on a 30-minute information session covering Rensselaer’s online, project-based Master program in Mechanical Engineering. Experienced engineers are asked to take on larger and more complex tasks as they progress in their careers, and this program provides the necessary breadth and depth, no matter where one’s career takes them. Learn how professionals can develop their practice in core mechanical disciplines while…
item.author: Students

item.title: Undergraduate Research Symposium | April 16
item.description: Date: Wednesday, April 16, 2025 2:00 PM - 4:00 PM - We are excited to announce this year’s Undergraduate Research Symposium to be held April 16 from 2:00 PM to 4:00 PM in the CBIS Atrium. We strongly encourage students currently working on an Undergraduate Research Project, either for credit or funding, to sign up at the attached link, and showcase their work. This event is free and open to anyone who may be interested in learning more about URP for a future semester.
item.author: Students

item.title: Looking for an Apartment? | April 15
item.description: Date: Tuesday, April 15, 2025 10:30 AM - 11:30 AM - All students are welcome to attend this session to learn about how to search for — and explore the considerations for selecting — an apartment, as well as get information on the resources that the Off-Campus Commons has to offer.
item.author: Students

item.title: Spring 2025 Student Course Evaluations Now Open
item.description: Date: Monday, April 14, 2025 (all day) - Spring 2025 student course evaluations are now open. The evaluation period is from 4/11 through 4/24. Your feedback is very important to the Institute, the five schools, and their departments, so please complete evaluation surveys for all your courses! Evaluations will be available through Thursday, April 24, 2025.
item.author: Students

item.title: Undergraduate Research Symposium - Poster Prep Night | April 14
item.description: Date: Monday, April 14, 2025 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM - TriBeta Biology Honors Society is hosting a presentation night for students on April 14 from 6:00 PM to 8:00 PM! This informal event is a great opportunity to receive peer feedback on your presentations, all undergrads are welcome to present their research. This event isn’t limited to just research… if you have any course projects/slide presentations that you think are interesting, we would love to see those as well! If you would like to…
item.author: Students

item.title: Physics, Applied Physics and Astronomy Colloquium: Professor Yiping Zhao, University of Georgia, | April 16
item.description: Date: Wednesday, April 16, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Title and abstract to be announced.
item.author: Community

item.title: IEEE EPS Mini Colloquium on Semiconductor Technology Evolution | April 18 (Registration Required)
item.description: Date: Friday, April 18, 2025 8:00 AM - 1:30 PM - The IEEE EDS/EPS MHV and RPI Chapters are excited to announce the upcoming 2nd Mini-Colloquium (MQ) 2025 on Semiconductor Technology Evolution, which will take place at CBIS Auditorium, RPI campus, on April 18th, 2025. The event is open to ALL! Registration is required. Register here: https://events.vtools.ieee.org/m/476707
item.author: Community

item.title: Commencement and Ph.D. Hooding Registration
item.description: Attention, graduates! Registration is open for this year’s Commencement ceremony and Ph.D. Hooding ceremony. Keep an eye on your inbox for an email from Tassel with registration instructions, and be sure to complete your registration by Monday, April 21. If you’re participating in both Commencement and the Ph.D. Hooding, you’ll receive one registration email for both events. Haven’t received your email? Contact commencement@rpi.edu for assistance.
item.author: Community

item.title: Math Coloquium & Annual AWM Seminar: Jennifer Crodelle (Middlebury College) | April 16
item.description: Date: Wednesday, April 16, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - This Mathematical Sciences Colloquium and Annual AWM Seminar will feature a presentation titled “The effect of retinal waves on the formation of visual receptive fields” by Dr. Jen Crodelle, Assistant Professor of Mathematics at Middlebury College in VT.
item.author: Community

item.title: Computer Science Colloquia - Chen Wang - Efficient and Robust Learning Algorithm Design: Online Learning and Clustering |April 14
item.description: Date: Monday, April 14, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Chen Wang is a postdoctoral researcher hosted jointly by Vladimir (Vova) Braverman at Rice University and Samson Zhou at Texas A&M University. His research interests mainly focus on the intersections between Theoretical Computer Science and Machine Learning. Chen obtained his Ph.D. at Rutgers University, where he was advised by Sepehr Assadi. He is the recipient of the Rutgers SGS Research & Travel Award, and he obtained nominations…
item.author: Community

item.title: Honoring a Trailblazer: Garnet D. Baltimore Historical Marker Unveiling | April 15
item.description: Date: 4/15/2025 11:00 AM to 2:30 PM Join us for a powerful celebration of Garnet Douglass Baltimore, a pioneering civil engineer, member of the Rensselaer Alumni Hall of Fame, and the first African American graduate of RPI (Class of 1881). This special event will honor his enduring legacy with the unveiling of a New York State Historical Marker recognizing his remarkable contributions to…
item.author: Community

item.title: Leaders in Action Conversation with Christine Miller ’97, CEO of Melinta Therapeutics scheduled April 14
item.description: Date: Monday, April 14, 2025 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM - Date: Monday, April 14, 2025 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - During this session, host Prof. Azita Hirsa Ph.D. ’11 and Christine Miller ’97, CEO of Melinta Therapeutics discuss “The Philosophy on Transformational Leadership”. Participants will be able to ask relevant questions; refreshments will be served following the session.
item.author: Community

item.title: MSE Seminar: The Norman S. Stoloff Research Excellence Award Presentation | April 16
item.description: Date: Wednesday, April 16, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Topological valley Hall exciton-polariton condensation Wei Li, PhD Student in MSE and Molecularly-induced effects on the synthesis and properties of thin film inorganic/molecular-nanolayer interfaces and their multilayers Collin Rowe, PhD Student in MSE
item.author: Community

item.title: Stop by on World Quantum Day - 04/14/2025
item.description: Mark your calendars! World Quantum Day is coming Monday, April 14th, 2025 ! The RPI Quantum Computing Club and the Quantum Enablement and Development Team invite you to Quantum Show and Tell. Whether you’re a seasoned coder or just quantum-curious, this is your chance to explore the amazing world of quantum computing!
item.author: Community

item.title: Honoring a Trailblazer: The Garnet Baltimore Historical Marker Unveiling and Reception | April 15
item.description: Tuesday, April 15, 2025 11:00 AM - 2:30 PM - Join us to celebrate Garnet D. Baltimore, a pioneering civil engineer and RPI’s first African American graduate (Class of 1881), with the unveiling of a New York State Historical Marker honoring his contributions to engineering, landscape design, and the Troy community. See Event URL for details.
item.author: Community

item.title: RPI Community Easter Dinner | April 20 (RSVP)
item.description: Date: Sunday, April 20, 2025 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM - Rensselaer Christian Association, Cru RPI, and Newman Catholic Fellowship are working together to host a free dinner for the RPI community this Easter Sunday. Bring your friends and join us for fellowship and a good meal. Please RSVP in advance using the link below so we can plan how much food to prepare.See: https://docs…
item.author: Community

item.title: Lift & Learn | April 16
item.description: Date: Wednesday, April 16, 2025 12:00 PM - 1:30 PM - 1 hour of lift coaching from our Assistant Strength & Conditioning Coach, followed by 30 minutes of nutrition information on proper fueling for workouts. No experience necessary! Free and open to everyone with all equipment provided. Use the link to register today!
item.author: Community

item.title: CEE Seminar Speaker - Dr. Austin V. Angulo - SUNY University at Buffalo | April 16
item.description: Date: Wednesday, April 16, 2025 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - “Is this the real life? Virtual simulation and its role in understanding vulnerable road user safety”. Developing low-cost, low-risk methodologies for understanding road user behavior, safety, and perception has been an aspiration within the field of transportation for decades. Further information provided at the seminar.
item.author: Community

item.title: Department of Chemistry Seminar Series | April 15
item.description: Date: Tuesday, April 15, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - The Harteck Lecture Series in Physical Chemistry will feature Sherry Yennello, Regent’s Professor of Chemistry and Bright Chair in Nuclear Science at Texas A&M University. She will speak about “From X-rays to Alpha Particles: Nuclear Chemistry Curing Cancer”.
item.author: Community

item.title: National Academy of Engineering 2025 Bernard M. Gordon Prize Ceremony | April 16 (RSVP)
item.description: Date: Wednesday, April 16, 2025 3:00 PM - 5:00 PM - National Academy of Engineering presents the 2025 Bernard M. Gordon Prize for Innovation in Engineering and Technology Education to Prof. Georges Belfort and Prof. Steven Cramer. Location: CBIS, Howard P. Isermann Auditorium. Ceremony and Reception RSVP: https://webforms.rpi.edu/gordon-prize-ceremony
item.author: Community

item.title: Fall 2025-2026 Meal Plans announced
item.description: Fall 2025-2026 Unlimited- Unlimited meals per week to be used in Resident Dining Halls, plus $150 Flex Dollars per year ($75 at the start of each semester). Non-transferable. Available to all students, $8,810/year - $4,405 charged per semester. 19 On Demand 19 anytime meals per week to be used in Resident Dining Halls, plus $450 Flex Dollars per year ($225 at the start of each semester). Non-transferable. Available to all students. $8,810/year - $4,405charged per semester
item.author: Community

item.title: Take Charge of Your Health
item.description:
The Division of Human Resources is inviting you to join us for lunch and a Health Benefits Info Session where we’ll walk through everything you need to know about your coverage and how to take charge of your health. Representatives from CDPHP will facilitate this presentation and will be available to answer any questions.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Faculty and Staff
